column4: - I've been thinking about trying to kill all of X and try to reinstall it or something
that may work ... if you do that try running x with the default vid card drivers and see if it will at least start up for you
if it does then you can go about installing the drivers for your vid card at that point
- yeah, I think the next step is a braindead "vesa" video mode X setup, I guess
- maybe I'll do something low-tech like a fluxbox wm
last time i had to deal with this was about 8 years ago ... and it seems that commands have changed a bit
- yeah.. no big deal.. I'm going to have to get drastic on myself, I think..
- might even contemplate a complete reinstall
it dosent set up propely on a fresh install ?
- haven't tried that yet - this is my mythtv backend.. didn't want to take it out for too long
did you install server and then add X ?
- no, started with Desktop install
so you have had X running on this before ?
- for about a year..  not sure what broke it... I, unfortunately made a few changes that I didn't keep track of..
ahhh i c.
- then I realized I'd broken it..  - stupid me
- thanks for the help.. think I'm going to take a crack at this stuff tomorrow morning
well i would start with reinstalling X to see if that fixes it ... if not, you may be looking at a reinstall
- yeah... we'll see :)  Thanks a lot for the quick attention/help
ok take care
wish i could have been more help ...
- no problem.  at least it wasn't quick - would have made me feel like an idiot :)
